intro: Cremanthodium hookeri f. anomalum, commonly known as the anomalous hookeri. This plant is a flowering species belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its distinctive floral morphology. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes, where it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in capitula, typical of the Asteraceae family. Its unique floral structure and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
